cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi ENE of Great Abaco Island and 210 mi E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west toward the north-western Bahamas today, then expected to turn WNW and northwest, crossing the Florida Peninsula tonight and Thursday, and lifting north-northeast across Georgia and the Carolinas Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east coast of Florida between Boca Raton and the Flagler/Volusia County line

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning, Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: No tropical storm or hurricane watch in effect for the west-central Florida coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – north of Bonita Beach to Indian Pass, including Tampa Bay; Storm Surge Warning – Anclote River to Ochlockonee River, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the Florida Peninsula (both east and west coasts), Georgia coast, and portions of the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible beginning Wednesday evening, highest likelihood overnight into Thursday morning; gusts could briefly exceed 50 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible in Tampa Bay as onshore flow develops Wednesday night through Thursday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain with local amounts up to 8 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding around the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated risk of isolated tornadoes and dangerous marine conditions (high surf, rip currents) during the storm passage.
